pr_title: Allow specific return types on creation policy always

timeline.message:
Allow specific returns type on creation policy always

The AggregateCreationPolicy#ALWAYS will default to returning the
aggregate identifier after command handling. Similar to a command
handling constructor. However, this policy allows to be placed on
regular methods thus opening up to several return values. Hence, default
 to the aggregate identifier if no result is returned. Otherwise, return
 the result of command handling.

#creation-policy-always-return-value

timeline.author: m1l4n54v1c

replies.bodyText: Couldn't agree more, so added this just now.
replies.author: smcvb

replies.bodyText:
I'm wondering, why do we need to "resolve" anything? It's a method, so the return value of that method could simply be used as the result of the command, just like any other command handler.
In the constructor, we didn't have a choice. The result value of a constructor is always the created instance. Since it's pretty bad practice to return an aggregate as a command's result, we added the resolver there.
replies.author: abuijze

replies.bodyText: So if I follow you correctly, you wouldn't want to resolve the aggregate identifier if the return type is void?
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.message:
Allow null result

Allow null result if the handler's return type is not void.
